citations.narrative:
One adult shih tzu female with four puppies is housed in the whelping room with free access to the floor, including a
litterbox used by the licensee's cat. The litterbox contains cat feces that appears to be several days' accumulation of
waste. The presence of animal waste products in areas where animals are housed can lead to illness or disease. The
licensee must make sure that animal waste is disposed of in a manner that minimizes disease risks.

Two enclosures were too small for the dogs they contained. One enclosure measuring 28.5 inches by 60.5 inches
provided 1,724.25 square inches of space. The enclosure contained four Dachshund puppies (born 5/11/25) measuring
17.5 inches, 17 inches, 16.5 inches, and 16 inches respectively. Together the dogs required 2,071.5 square inches of
space. The enclosure was short by 347.25 square inches of space. Another enclosure measured 28.5 inches by 60.5
inches and provided 1,724.25 square inches of space. The enclosure contained 5 Teddy Bear puppies (born 6/26/25).
The puppies measures 14 inches, 14 inches, 13 inches, 13 inches, and 9 inches respectively. Together they required
1,747 square inches of space. The enclosure was short by 22.75 square inches of space.
Cage space requirements ensure the dogs have enough room to move about freely within their enclosures. It minimizes
the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also minimizes the spread of disease. The licensee must
ensure all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough floor space to meet the minimum floor space
requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
KEVIN WILKEN, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n

narrative:
3.1(f) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
One adult shih tzu female with four puppies is housed in the whelping room with free access to the floor, including a 
litterbox used by the licensee's cat. The litterbox contains cat feces that appears to be several days' accumulation of 
waste. The presence of animal waste products in areas where animals are housed can lead to illness or disease. The 
licensee must make sure that animal waste is disposed of in a manner that minimizes disease risks. 
3.6(c)(1)(i)  Repeat
   
Primary enclosures. 
Two enclosures were too small for the dogs they contained. One enclosure measuring 28.5 inches by 60.5 inches 
provided 1,724.25 square inches of space. The enclosure contained four Dachshund puppies (born 5/11/25) measuring 
17.5 inches, 17 inches, 16.5 inches, and 16 inches respectively. Together the dogs required 2,071.5 square inches of 
space. The enclosure was short by 347.25 square inches of space. Another enclosure measured 28.5 inches by 60.5 
inches and provided 1,724.25 square inches of space. The enclosure contained 5 Teddy Bear puppies (born 6/26/25). 
The puppies measures 14 inches, 14 inches, 13 inches, 13 inches, and 9 inches respectively. Together they required 
1,747 square inches of space. The enclosure was short by 22.75 square inches of space. 
 
Cage space requirements ensure the dogs have enough room to move about freely within their enclosures. It minimizes 
the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also minimizes the spread of disease. The licensee must 
ensure all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough floor space to meet the minimum floor space 
requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
KEVIN WILKEN, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n
